main event: A round, silver dollar-sized object with alternating red and white colors was observed in the sky south of Odebolt, Iowa on October 12, 1957.
interesting points: The object was in sight for 15 minutes before suddenly disappearing.
The object was described as very bright and moving in a straight and level heading towards the southwest.
The observation was made by a Ground Observer Corps (GOC) observer who called the GOC post in Odebolt, Iowa to alert them to the object.
Multiple witnesses, including the GOC observer and an electrician, observed the object.
The winds at various altitudes did not coincide with the movement of the object, suggesting it was not a weather balloon.
sighted object: a round, silver dollar-sized object with alternating red and white colors
